rComments: He has a heart of GOLD. Best prof I have ever had. I developed my writing abilities and research skills under his care. He really cares for his students and he is the reason I am in grad school. God bless him, amen!

Hands down the worst prof I have ever had. He doesnt teach anything, just relies on students doing presentations to teach the class or guest speakers. Does not have any regard for his students or want them to succeed. All he cares about is himself, and is not in the slightest bit understanding of circumstances. Will be filing a complaint.

WORST PROF. Mandatory attendence, super small class, no blackboard and way too much work. The prof expected a 20 page research paper, debate, and multiple presentations, literally the worst class I have ever had to sit through, keeping in mind I dropped this class 5 minutes into the lecture, save yourself the struggle and switch into another class.

You'll enjoy the course more than the professor. Digiocomo usually reads his lectures off notes, so it can become dry. The structure of the course was really exciting. He seems great for being available at all hours to answer questions and provide feedback. He gives second chances for assignments. Good experience overall.

Terrible prof, avoid at all costs! He does not care about students, is rude when answering questions, reads from the textbook during lectures and completely useless in office hours. He is just simply not able to teach.  Despite the course material being really interesting, he makes the class absolutely boring. Take the course with someone else.

Textbook is expensive ($100). It is only for a reference. Prepare to take a lot of notes or better yet, get all the class note from 'note solutions.' He uses lecture notes repeatedly semester after semester. Memorize lecture note, you will ace midterms and exams. Do not skip classes, he gives out group assignments in surprise to penalize absence.
Goes way too fast. Can't even take notes that you just end up giving up in the end. His lectures are basically enumerating statistics and random facts. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS
Avoid if possible. Not approachable and can be rude at times. Not lenient and marks fairly harsh. Avoid!!

Very rude and impatient when asked to repeat himself. Wording in the exam was unclear, talks way too fast and overall not very nice to deal with. However, his TA marked the assignments with more leniency & was much clearer on subjects.

Although the course material is dry and he seems strict at times, the course is not that hard. The discussion groups are easy marks and you'll do well on the paper if you follow the guidelines. I was lucky enough to have a pretty good T.A. though. I would definitely recommend this class if you're interested in Canadian politics.

Well - he has had some bad feedback if you look below! I am mixed. I think he believes in the students that really try and doesn't have patience for slackers. I went to see him for help on a paper and he was very helpful. He does come off blunt at times but I think it is because he cares. He will point you out for questions!

He was the most demeaning and unapproachable professor that I have ever encountered. He criticized everyone instead of helping them like he was supposed to do. He thought of himself as superior to students and he didn't like you if you didn't agree with him or question his teaching. The book was very expensive and useless and I regret buying it.

Very unapprochable professor and mean to his students. His lectures are almost completely unrelated to what is in the texbook but you still need to read it for the final exam. Entire pre-final mark based on discussion group participation and 1 research paper split into two parts. You have no idea what your mark is going into the final exam.

Gordon Digiacomo is condescending, and just not a nice guy. I have never met anyone so unapproachable. As a few others have posted, it takes him about a month to hand anything back. By far the worst professor, he is rated poorly at Carleton too ha ha.

Worst professor I have had so far. Arrogant and unapproachable. He does not hand back assignments in a timely fashion - completed exam December 17 and am still waiting for my mark on January 14th. The final was unrelated to the course and his review was useless.

The worst professor I've had. Lectures are boring and the class is unstructured. This man loves lists, and you better learn them. Bring your student card to the exam, not your OC Transpo ISIC card that has your photo and student number. That's not good enough for him. Drop him if it's possible.
Lot's of work, you won't get a single mark back on an assignment until the semester is just about over. He's a ****, but if you have a similar opinion to him he'll give you a decent grade.

Simply awful. He is hard to stand for 1h20 at a time. If you take this course it is to learn his personal opinions about the readings, not their actual message. You can also expect to learn nothing, do a lot of work, and get a mediocre grade.

Awesome professor! Encourages class debate and never shoots anyone down based on their federalism views. His clarity on assignments could be improved but overall amazing class! Take him in the summer if you can, and at an upper level, he's super laid-back!

He knows his stuff, but doesn't understand that we don't. His grading definitely varies, so make sure to get on his good side. DGDs are essentially useless. Don't get stuck on copying every single word of his lecture - you'll get lost quickly. Not very clear on what he wants on assignments.

Terrible prof. Seriously. This guy gives out way too many little assignments and treats you like you're in the 8th grade. His lectures are hard to get through too. I really think he'd be better off teaching in a high school somewhere...
Terrible professor. No structure, changes assignments at the last minutes.  Terrible. Do not take his class.

Horrible prof. He reads over important things way too quickly, then discusses unimportant issues for long periods of time, getting students to get their usually heavily bias input in, which takes up time we need for actual lectures, putting us behind. He also changes his assignments at the last minute, doesn't put slides up and has no structure.

The absolute worst! He just gave us a handout on our research proposal worth 15% due in 5 days. He has made changes to it for the last 3 weeks and JUST gave us an actual handout which still doesn't have everything he wants on it. Laughs at students when they give even slightly wrong answers.  avoid at all costs
Worst Prof i've had. He marks to his opinion and the class is not well organized. Do not take this class.

Knowledgeable, but not particularly forgiving of mistakes, which first and second years often make. Will call on random students for answers, but is known to laugh at their wrong answers. Would be better off teaching grad students, or students who have been in university for a few years.

This prof is designs the class much like a class you would take in high school. This is very disappointing considering that we spend $500 per class. He picks on students in the class to answer questions undermining us. This is repulsive quality. Avoid if you wish to have a fulfilling experience and learn. If not, take it then!
Doest post notes......Selects students to answer questions during lectures.Reads way to fast.

He knows the material well, but the lectures are unorganized and sometimes hard to follow.  He keeps interupting the lecture to randomly select students to answer questions. Gives pointless assignments.  Not recomended.
